executable.title: BrainTissuesMask
executable.description: This CLI module aims to extract brain tissues mask. This tool was intensively tested with T1 MRI images, but the pipeline could be applied to any other structural MRI image. The goal here is to provide a brain tissue segmentation tool in order to provide a brain mask for other segmentation procedures. The MS Lesion Track segmentation modules apply a T1 white matter masks directly as input parameter, and this module could help you to create the requested white matter mask.
executable.contributor: Antonio Carlos da S. Senra Filho (University of Sao Paulo), Luiz Otavio Murta Junior (University of Sao Paulo)
executable.acknowledgements: This work was partially funded by CNPq grant 201871/2015-7/SWE and CAPES.

image.name: inputVolume
image.label: Input Volume
image.description: Input volume. The algorithm works better with high resolution T1 MRI images.

parameters.label: Type of Tissue Output
parameters.description: Parameters to be applied on the previous white matter segmentation procedure.

boolean.name: oneTissue
boolean.description: Choose if you want all the tissues classes or only one class segmented.
boolean.label: Separate one tissue class

string-enumeration.name: typeTissue
string-enumeration.description: Choose what is the brain tissue label that you want as the output label.
string-enumeration.label: Tissue

parameters.label: Brain Tissue Segmentation Parameters
parameters.description: Parameters to set the brain tissue segmentation procedure.

string-enumeration.name: segMethod
string-enumeration.description: Choose the segmentation method to be applied on T1 image
string-enumeration.label: Segmentation Paradigm

integer.name: numClass
integer.label: Number of classes
integer.description: Set the number of tissues classes desired to segment in the input image. Default: 4 (Background, CSF, Gray Matter and White Matter)

boolean.name: guessMeans
boolean.description: Use K-Means algorithm to set a first initial mean values guess. If this option is selected, the Tissues mean value guess parameter is not used.
boolean.label: Use Gaussian Mixture Model initial guess

double-vector.name: meanGuess
double-vector.description: A first approximation for the mean value of each tissue class.
double-vector.label: Tissues mean value guess
